Detailed Description

Objects of the is class represent communication events.

They get passed up to the application through dispatch handlers (see DispatchHandler).

Definition at line 49 of file Event.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Hypertable::Event::Event ( Type  ct,
int  cid,
struct sockaddr_in &  a,
int  err = 0,
Header::HeaderT *  h = 0 
) [inline]

Initializes the event object with message data.

If a message header is supplied, then the threadGroup member is initialized as follows: 

 threadGroup = ((uint64_t)connId << 32) | header->gid;
otherwise it is set to 0. The thread group is used to serialize requests destined for the same application object.

Parameters:
ct type of event
cid connection ID
a remote address of connection on which this event was generated
err error code associated with this event
h pointer to message data for MESSAGE events (NOTE: this object takes ownership of this data and deallocates it when it gets destroyed)

Definition at line 98 of file Event.h.

Member Function Documentation

std::string Hypertable::Event::toString (  ) 

Generates a one-line string representation of the event.

For example: 

   Event: type=MESSAGE protocol=hyperspace id=2 gid=0 headerLen=16 totalLen=20 from=127.0.0.1:38040

Definition at line 128 of file Event.h.

uint64_t Hypertable::Event::threadGroup

Thread group to which this message belongs.

Used to serialize messages destined for the same object. This value is created in the constructor and is the combination of the connection ID and the gid field in the message header: 

 threadGroup = ((uint64_t)connId << 32) | header->gid;
